result.execSummary:
The defendant Demiterece Lashun Harper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cash bail to be applied.

*4/11/2017  Set at zero.

Provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
Pay  DNA surcharge, Court costs and all applicable assessments.  To be collected by DOC up to 25% from defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

*01-09-2020/Judge T. Christopher Dee - Court granted defendant 34 days of additional sentence credit for a total of 53 days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for time served to be determined.
*05-03-2018/Order amended to include 19 days of sentence credit.

Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of Extended Supervision.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.   Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

Per Remittitur Dated December 18, 2019, Appeal No. 2018AP001199CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on November 6, 2019, that:  
IT IS ORDERED that the no-merit report is rejected and this appeal is dismissed without prejudice. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for filing a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended through January 6, 2020.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.82(2)(a) (2017-18).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order dismissing

Per order dated November 6, 2019, Appeal No. 2018AP1199-CRNM, 
IT IS ORDERED that the no-merit report is rejected nd this appeal is dismissed without prejudice. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERD that the deadline for filing a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended through January 6, 2020.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.82(2)(a) (2017-18). 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.
Motion to Voluntarily Dismiss the No Merit Without Prejudice and Extend Deadline for Filing a Postconviction Motion, received

Per order dated October 23, 2019, Appeal No. 2018AP1199-CRNM, 
IT IS ORDERED that the motion for a sixty-day extension of the deadline established in our order of September 18, 2019, is denied. 
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, no later than November 1, 2019, appeallate counsel shall file either: (1) a supplemental no-merit report addressing sentence credit and trial counsel's effectiveness in regard o sentence credit; or (2) a motion to convert this no-merit appeal to an appeal on the merits and to establish the deadline for filing an appellate brief; or (3) a motion to voluntarily dismiss this appeal without prejudice and to extend the deadline for filing a postconviction motion.

Motion to Convert the Proceeding to an Appeal on the Merits, received.
Corrected Motion to Enlarge time to Convert the Proceedin to an Appeal on the Merits, received.

Per order dated September 18, 0219, Appeal No. 2018AP1199-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the hold previously imposed in this matter is lifted and the proceedings may continue.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, no later than October 18, 2019, Attorney Murray shall file a supplemental no-merit report as discussed in this order or, alternatively, an appropriate motion either to dismiss the instant appeal wihtout prejudice or convert the proceeding to an appeal on the merits and to extend appellate deadlines.
Supplemental Circuit Court Case Record received by Court of Appeals. Appeal No. 2018AP001199 CRNM

per order dated March 11, 2019, Appeal No. 2018AP1199-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that this appeal remains held in abeyance pending a decision by the Wisconsin Supreme Court in State v. Trammell, No. 2017AP1206-CR.

Defendant Demiterece Lashun Harper in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter before the Court for Restitution Hearing.  Arguments heard.  Court sets restitution at $0.
From defendant
Of Intent to Pursue Post Conviction Relief received.  Filed copy sent to Attorney Stuller in the self-addressed stamped envelope provided.

Defendant Demiterece Lashun Harper in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Demiterece Lashun Harper in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS,consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for time served to be determined.  Attorney Stuller did not have the information to provide to the Court a specific amount of credit due and owing.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution to be determined.  Victim to provide written verification of wage loss 
-Cash bail on deposit to be used towards restitution which shall be determined at the next Court date. 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable assessments to be collected by DOC up to 25% from defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC up to 25% from the defendant's funds held in the defendant's inmate account and during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment 
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain employment  
-No contact with Dominique S., Cazzie S., Virgil S., Mandingo S., All Star Bar 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 
-No prescription medications without a valid prescription

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Demiterece Lashun Harper in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the hour of 1:20 p.m., trial continues.  Out of the presence of the jury, Court conducts collequy with the defendant regarding his right to testify.  Sworn for the defense:  Demiterece Harper.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directive verdict heard and denied.  Jury instruction conference conducted.    Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 2:40 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 3:15 p.m. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armpr; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Sheriff's Department pending sentencing

Defendant Demiterece Lashun Harper in court with attorney Virginia m Stuller.  Defendant Demiterece Lashun Harper in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  At the hour of 8:50 a.m., Jury Trial continues.   Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Virgil Smith, Dominique Smith, City of Milwaukee Police Detective Tony Castro.  Exhibits 1-6 received.  State rests.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion at close of State's case is denied.  Jury in box.  Sworn for the defense:  Yolanda Harper.  Court adjourns matter to 1:00 p.m. this date for continuation of jury trial.
Preliminary Instructions
